title: Two Sum
description:
Given an array of integers `nums` and an integer `target`, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to `target`.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.
hints: Consider using a hash map to store values you've already seen.
For each number, what other number would you need to find?
Can you do this in one pass through the array?

title: Contains Duplicate
description: Given an integer array `nums`, return `true` if any value appears at least twice in the array, and return `false` if every element is distinct.
hints: Use a hash set to track seen elements.
What's the time complexity of checking set membership?

title: First Unique Character
description: Given a string `s`, find the first non-repeating character in it and return its index. If it does not exist, return -1.
hints: Count the frequency of each character.
Iterate again to find the first char with frequency 1.

title: Group Anagrams
description: Given an array of strings `strs`, group the anagrams together. You can return the answer in any order.
hints: Sort each string and use it as a key.

title: LRU Cache
description: Design a data structure that follows the constraints of a Least Recently Used (LRU) cache.
hints: Combine a hash map with a doubly linked list.
Hash map gives O(1) access, linked list maintains order.

title: Longest Consecutive Sequence
description: Given an unsorted array of integers `nums`, return the length of the longest consecutive elements sequence.
hints: Use a hash set for O(1) lookups.
Only start counting from sequence starts (num-1 not in set).

title: Subarray Sum Equals K
description: Given an array of integers `nums` and an integer `k`, return the total number of subarrays whose sum equals to `k`.
hints: Store prefix sum counts in a hash map.

title: Top K Frequent Elements
description: Given an integer array `nums` and an integer `k`, return the `k` most frequent elements.
hints: Count frequencies with a hash map.
Use bucket sort or a heap for top k.

title: Valid Anagram
description: Given two strings `s` and `t`, return `true` if `t` is an anagram of `s`, and `false` otherwise.

title: Isomorphic Strings
description: Given two strings `s` and `t`, determine if they are isomorphic. Two strings are isomorphic if the characters in `s` can be replaced to get `t`.
hints: Use two hash maps for bidirectional mapping.
Check both s→t and t→s mappings.

title: Binary Search
description: Given an array of integers `nums` sorted in ascending order, and an integer `target`, return the index if the target is found. If not, return -1.
hints: Use two pointers: left and right.
Calculate mid and compare with target.

title: Search Insert Position
description: Given a sorted array and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be inserted.
hints: When not found, left pointer is the insert position.

title: First Bad Version
description: You are given an API `isBadVersion(version)` which returns whether version is bad. Find the first bad version.

title: Find Peak Element
description: A peak element is an element that is strictly greater than its neighbors. Find a peak element and return its index.

title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
description: Search for a target in a rotated sorted array. Return the index if found, otherwise return -1.

title: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
description: Find the minimum element in a rotated sorted array.
hints: Binary search to find rotation point.
Compare mid with right to determine direction.

title: Search a 2D Matrix
description: Search for a target value in an m x n integer matrix. Integers in each row are sorted.
hints: Treat it as a flattened sorted array.
Use binary search with index conversion.

title: Find First and Last Position
description: Find the starting and ending position of a given target value in a sorted array.
hints: One for leftmost, one for rightmost.

title: Kth Smallest Element in Sorted Matrix
description: Given an n x n matrix where rows and columns are sorted, find the kth smallest element.

title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
description: Find the median of two sorted arrays. The overall run time complexity should be O(log(m+n)).
hints: Binary search on the smaller array.
Partition both arrays to find median.

title: Valid Parentheses
description: Given a string containing just '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.
hints: Use a stack to track opening brackets.
Pop and match when you see a closing bracket.

title: Min Stack
description: Design a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving the minimum element in constant time.
hints: Keep track of minimum at each level.
Use a second stack or store pairs.

title: Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation
description: Evaluate the value of an arithmetic expression in Reverse Polish Notation.
hints: Pop two operands when you see an operator.

title: Daily Temperatures
description: Given temperatures, return an array where answer[i] is the number of days until a warmer temperature.

title: Next Greater Element I
description: Find the next greater element for each element in nums1 from nums2.
hints: Process nums2 with a monotonic stack.
Store results in a hash map.

title: Largest Rectangle in Histogram
description: Find the largest rectangular area possible in a histogram.

title: Decode String
description: Decode an encoded string like "3[a2[c]]" to "accaccacc".
hints: Use two stacks: one for counts, one for strings.

title: Basic Calculator II
description: Implement a basic calculator to evaluate a simple expression string with +, -, *, /.
hints: Push +/- numbers to stack, sum at end.

title: Asteroid Collision
description: Find out the state of asteroids after all collisions. Positive = right, negative = left.
hints: Collision only when right-moving meets left-moving.

title: Remove K Digits
description: Remove k digits from the number so that the new number is the smallest possible.

title: Implement Queue using Stacks
description: Implement a first in first out (FIFO) queue using only two stacks.
hints: Use one stack for push, one for pop.

title: Implement Stack using Queues
description: Implement a last-in-first-out (LIFO) stack using only two queues.
hints: Push to back, then rotate to front.

title: Sliding Window Maximum
description: Return the max sliding window for each window of size k.

title: Task Scheduler
description: Given tasks and cooling period, find minimum intervals needed to finish all tasks.
hints: Most frequent task determines idle slots.
Fill idle slots with other tasks.

title: K Closest Points to Origin
description: Return the k closest points to the origin (0, 0).
hints: Use a max heap of size k.

title: Merge K Sorted Lists
description: Merge k sorted linked lists and return it as one sorted list.
hints: Use a min heap to track smallest heads.

title: Kth Largest Element in Stream
description: Design a class to find the kth largest element in a stream.
hints: Use a min heap of size k.
Top of heap is kth largest.

title: Design Circular Queue
description: Design your implementation of the circular queue.

title: Last Stone Weight
description: Smash the two heaviest stones together. Return the weight of the last remaining stone.
hints: Pop two, push difference if non-zero.

title: Find Median from Data Stream
description: Design a data structure that supports adding integers and finding the median.
hints: Use two heaps: max heap for lower half, min heap for upper.

title: Reverse Linked List
description: Given the head of a singly linked list, reverse the list.
hints: Use three pointers: prev, curr, next.

title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
description: Merge two sorted linked lists into one sorted list.

title: Linked List Cycle
description: Given head, determine if the linked list has a cycle in it.

title: Middle of the Linked List
description: Given a non-empty linked list, return the middle node.
hints: When fast reaches end, slow is at middle.

title: Remove Nth Node From End
description: Remove the nth node from the end of the list.
hints: Move fast pointer n steps ahead.

title: Add Two Numbers
description: Add two numbers represented as linked lists (digits in reverse order).

title: Palindrome Linked List
description: Given the head of a linked list, return true if it is a palindrome.

title: Intersection of Two Linked Lists
description: Find the node at which the intersection of two linked lists begins.

title: Copy List with Random Pointer
description: Construct a deep copy of a list where each node has an additional random pointer.
hints: Use a hash map to map old to new nodes.

title: Invert Binary Tree
description: Given the root of a binary tree, invert the tree and return its root.
hints: Swap left and right children recursively.
Base case is when node is null.

title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
description: Find the maximum depth of a binary tree.

title: Same Tree
description: Given roots of two binary trees, check if they are the same.

title: Symmetric Tree
description: Check whether a binary tree is a mirror of itself.
hints: Compare left subtree with mirror of right.

title: Validate Binary Search Tree
description: Determine if a binary tree is a valid BST.

title: Lowest Common Ancestor of BST
description: Find the lowest common ancestor of two nodes in a BST.

starterCode.cpp:
TreeNode* lowestCommonAncestor(TreeNode* root, TreeNode* p, TreeNode* q) {
}

hints: If both < node, go left; if both > node, go right.

title: Binary Tree Paths
description: Return all root-to-leaf paths in a binary tree.
hints: Add path when reaching a leaf.

title: Kth Smallest Element in BST
description: Return the kth smallest element in a BST.

title: Construct Tree from Preorder and Inorder
description: Build a binary tree from preorder and inorder traversal arrays.
hints: Find root in inorder to split left/right.

title: Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree
description: Design an algorithm to serialize and deserialize a binary tree.

starterCode.cpp:
string serialize(TreeNode* root) {}
TreeNode* deserialize(string data) {}

title: Number of Islands
description: Count the number of islands in a 2D grid of '1's (land) and '0's (water).
hints: Use BFS or DFS to explore connected land.

title: Clone Graph
description: Return a deep copy of a connected undirected graph.
hints: Use a hash map to track cloned nodes.

title: Course Schedule
description: Determine if you can finish all courses given prerequisites.

title: Word Ladder
description: Find the shortest transformation sequence from beginWord to endWord.

starterCode.cpp:
int ladderLength(string beginWord, string endWord, vector<string>& wordList) {
}

title: Pacific Atlantic Water Flow
description: Find all cells where water can flow to both Pacific and Atlantic oceans.

title: Network Delay Time
description: Find the minimum time for all nodes to receive a signal from source node.

starterCode.cpp:
int networkDelayTime(vector<vector<int>>& times, int n, int k) {
}

hints: Return max distance or -1 if unreachable.

title: Graph Valid Tree
description: Check if given graph forms a valid tree (connected, no cycles).
hints: Check connectivity with Union-Find or DFS.

title: Number of Connected Components
description: Count the number of connected components in an undirected graph.

title: Alien Dictionary
description: Derive the order of letters in an alien language from a sorted dictionary.
hints: Build graph from adjacent word comparisons.

title: Redundant Connection
description: Find the edge that can be removed to make the graph a valid tree.

title: Sort an Array
description: Sort an array of integers in ascending order without using built-in functions.
hints: Use merge sort or quick sort.
Aim for O(n log n) complexity.

title: Merge Intervals
description: Merge all overlapping intervals.

title: Insert Interval
description: Insert a new interval into a list of non-overlapping intervals.
hints: Add non-overlapping before, merge overlapping, add rest.

title: Sort Colors
description: Sort an array with elements 0, 1, 2 in-place (Dutch National Flag problem).

title: Kth Largest Element in Array
description: Find the kth largest element in an unsorted array.
hints: Or heap for O(n log k).

title: Wiggle Sort II
description: Reorder array so nums[0] < nums[1] > nums[2] < nums[3]...
hints: Place larger elements at odd indices.

title: Largest Number
description: Arrange numbers to form the largest possible number.
hints: Custom comparator: compare ab vs ba.

title: H-Index
description: Find a researcher's h-index from citation counts.

title: Meeting Rooms II
description: Find minimum number of conference rooms required.
hints: Use min heap to track end times.

title: Rotate List
description: Given a linked list, rotate the list to the right by k places.
hints: Find length and use modulo for k.
Connect tail to head, break at new tail.

title: Relative Sort Array
description: Sort arr1 such that the relative ordering of items in arr1 are the same as in arr2.
hints: Add elements in arr2 order, then remaining sorted.
